peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much does an art appraisal cost?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Art appraisers may adjust their hourly rate depending on the scope of the appraisal assignment, but on average you should expect to pay between $150-$500 per hour for a USPAP-compliant art appraisal.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How much does it cost to get art appraised?

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can I get my artwork valued?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: For local artists, you might have luck with regional galleries or art fairs. For more valuable or widely recognized pieces, auction houses like Heritage Auctions or Christie's could be an option. Online marketplaces like eBay or 1stDibs can also work if you've got proper documentation.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much does it cost to get art valued?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: How much does it cost? The certificate of valuation costs $250 (including GST) for the first artwork, with each additional original painting valued at $125.
